title: How to write a catching up e-mail to a client - Quora

response.answer_text: I realize we live in a modern world of global networking and technological progress, so you might wonder if some things have simply gone out of style… For example, like sending out a thank you email and asking if one is willing to catch up. But the truth is, politeness and gratitude will never go out of style!!! However, sometimes the way you communicate this needs to change. A “thank you/let’s catch up” is you expressing your gratitude and showing that you are hoping to continue a conversation to build the relationship. This will give you an edge over anyone who chooses not to catch up with their network. How do you do it? Email every person involved in your interactions with a client, from client assistants to the client, him/herself.Be sure to write something unique to each person! Why? Because they will compare notes about you, literally. You don’t want them to see that you used a template. It is frowned upon as insincere. Believe me: it’s worth it to write unique emails.Timing is important: Send the email when it is relevant and you have something to talk about, not just to say, “Wassup?”The email itself (see below):Add a Clear Subject Line Don’t make it more than five or six words. Short and clear is the best way to go. Good subject lines include: Hi, [name of recipient]. Catching up with you.Great speaking with youEnjoyed our conversation about [insert]2. Open With a Personal Greeting Double-check to be sure you have the correct name and spelling. 3. Express Gratitude for the Last Time You Spoke A straightforward statement works well, such as: “Thank you for work with me on the ABC Company.” You might add additional detail: “I appreciate the time you took to [add details of the interaction].” “I was very impressed by [insert what impressed you]” “It would be great if we could catch up regarding [insert your reason for catching up]. Would you be open to a quick call next week?” 4. Provide an Invitation to Further Connect Show yourself as being easy to get in touch with by adding: “I am easy to reach at this email address or my number at ***-***-****. Feel free to contact me anytime. I look forward to speaking with you.” 5. IMPORTANT: You are NOT shmoozing or boot-licking! One of the most important reasons for catching up is to show you are still interested in working with a client again. This is called, “being classy and respectful.” If you think otherwise, I invite you to examine why you think being nice to clients is a bad idea. Hope you think this answer is helpful!

The follow-up email should include: A well-crafted and catchy subject lineContext of the last conversation with the clientThe reason for the follow-up (lay a clear objective and purpose of the email)The most tricky thing out here is to understand that you need to create a sense of urgency with your email. Put a timeline to any offer that you may mention in the email or ask for an appointment. Use an effective closing statement like - I am looking forward to meeting you soon. So let me know your availability for a detailed discussion tomorrow at 14:00 hrs.Since you are one of our esteemed clients, we are extending this offer to you until the next 48 hours. So hurry up and contact us soon to avail this offer.Let me know if Friday, 10:00 hrs. work for you and I can give you a demo of our product and show you instant benefits of rolling out our application.These are just a few examples to help you understand how you can close the email. Be creative and keep all the above points in mind. It will definitely lead to a better response rate of the emails. Hope this helps!
